cwe_description: The software reads data past the end, or before the beginning, of the intended buffer. This can lead to crashes, information disclosure, or execution of arbitrary code.
explanation: The code calculates the available buffer size for UTF-8 decoding incorrectly. The expression (size_t)(p - parser->end) results in a large positive number due to integer underflow when p is less than parser->end. This causes uni_utf8_get_char_n to attempt to read beyond the allocated buffer (parser->end), leading to an out-of-bounds read vulnerability. This can result in information leakage, denial of service (crash), or other undefined behavior.

cwe_description: The software reads data past the end, or before the beginning, of an intended buffer. This can lead to crashes, information disclosure, or other unpredictable behavior.
explanation: The code calculates the 'max_len' argument for the 'uni_utf8_get_char_n' function incorrectly. It computes '(size_t)(p - parser->end)' instead of the correct remaining buffer length '(size_t)(parser->end - p)'. When 'p' is less than 'parser->end', this calculation results in a negative value. Casting this negative value to 'size_t' (an unsigned type) yields a very large positive number. This misleads 'uni_utf8_get_char_n' into believing that a vast amount of data is available, potentially causing it to read beyond the actual buffer boundary ('parser->end') if an incomplete multi-byte UTF-8 character is encountered at the end of the input, leading to an out-of-bounds read vulnerability.
